creator: ruben.laguna@gmail.com
text:
The current content of the file eclipse.readme states that "It
[eclipse.classpath] has exclusion filters for all the source files that depend
on optional jars.". But eclipse.classpath hasn't those exclusion filters. I'm
attaching a patch with updated names of the jars (commons-logging-1.1.jar) and
with the right exclusion filters.

Created attachment 19246
updated eclipse.classpath

* exclusion filters for code dependent on optional jars
* commons-logging.jar was renamed to commons-logging-1.1.jar
creator: ruben.laguna@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 19249
new eclipse.classpath

* removed some exclusion filters (*.properties)
* changed output folder to lib/ext

In this way JMeter is easier to run from the eclipse ide itself. (Because
jmeter tries to find the classes in lib/ext).
creator: ruben.laguna@gmail.com

text:
Thanks for the report.

However, I'm not going to change the output directory to lib/ext, as that 
messes up the builds.

I've updated the file to correct the libraries (jexl is included) and the 
exclusions.
creator: sebb@apache.org
